text: In the United States Army, refuel on the move (ROM), is a logistical action, for sustaining an army while on maneuver. to reach a destination.Refuel on the move A ROM for Army vehicles is akin to in-flight refuelling for aircraft or UAVs. A forward arming and refuelling point (FARP)FARP is a location for a refuel on the move. A convoy of vehicles on the move will have a pre-planned refuelling point at which each vehicle's fuel can be replenished to the 75% level within 30 seconds. Sustainment personnel conduct a refuel on the move.Army Universal Task List ==Notes== Category:Military logistics of the United States
title: Refuel On the Move
